entry.title: Re: Multiple Note Downloads - No Internet
entry.content:
Hi Werner,

1. Check this SAP note 3213132; you might need to download each SAP note manually from SAP Support and upload it to your SAP system.

2. If the same SAP notes are implemented in any other SAP system, you may collect that data and cofile import the same.(Both SAP system versions should be the same).

Regards

SS

entry.title: Re: Vendor Currency Supplier
entry.content:
FB60 is a FI transaction for vendor invoices without a purchase order. By default, the system uses the company code currency (local currency) in the header. The vendor’s currency maintained in the vendor master (Purchasing view) influences PO-based invoices (MIRO), not FB60.

One option is enhancement via BAdI or Substitution. Implement BAdI FI_DOCUMENT or Validation/Substitution in FI:

Logic:

  • Read vendor master (LFA1) for currency.
  • If vendor currency ≠ company code currency, override the header currency before posting.

This is the most flexible approach for vendor-specific defaults.

entry.title: Bank statement - XML file with a webaddress in a tag - any solutions for uploading?
entry.content:
Dear all,

I hope one of you experts can help me. 

One of our clients has a problem with their bank statements, as they can't upload them into SAP Cloud ERP (public edition) as SAP doesn't recognize the file as a bank statement.

The reason that SAP doesn't recognise the file as a bank statement is because the bank has added a weblink / webaddress to the Entry tag (<Ntry>).  When I remove this manually, so the tag only looks like <Ntry> the file is uploaded as normal.  

The bank says this happens sometimes and that its not a problem for most ERP systems. They stated clearly that there is nothing they can or will do, and that it will have to be solved through the SAP system. I disagree but still have to try and find a solution. 

Does anyone know if there are any settings in SAP to make the system be able to read and accept the file with a webaddress? I have been unsuccesful in my search so hoping someone will have seen this situation before and be able to help.  

Many thanks in advance, 

M

entry.title: Re: Service consumption model (SRVC) - RFC - How to regnerate or edit a generated model?
entry.content:
Hello @rb,

You can't regenerate the Consumption Model, it is recommended to delete it and generate a new one.

You can check this community post for more details: Service Consumption Model 2 for OData Client Proxy

Also I would recommend to follow the SAP Help for the ADT 2023 FPS3 product and not the ADT BTP as they may be some differences in the docs, you can find it here.

entry.title: Fragment not showing data in SAPUI5 app in SAP BAS (Component-preload.js & model issue)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am creating a simple “Hello SAPUI5” app in SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) to practice MVC, data binding, fragments, and routing.

I am facing two issues:
1. When I click “Open Dialog”, the fragment opens but no data is displayed.
2. In the console, I see:
• Component-preload.js not found
• Manifest: dataSource "localModel" not found or invalid

Folder Structure:
webapp/
├── index.html
├── Component.js
├── manifest.json
├── model/
│    └── data.json
├── view/
│    └── View1.view.xml
├── controller/
│    └── View1.controller.js
└── fragment/
     └── Dialog.fragment.xml


manifest.json (relevant part)

{
  "_version": "1.12.0",
  "sap.app": {
    "id": "myApp",
    "type": "application",
    "applicationVersion": {
      "version": "1.0.0"
    },
    "title": "Hello SAPUI5"
  },
  "sap.ui": {
    "technology": "UI5",
    "deviceTypes": {
      "desktop": true,
      "tablet": true,
      "phone": true
    }
  },
  "sap.ui5": {
    "dependencies": {
      "minUI5Version": "1.84.0",
      "libs": {
        "sap.m": {}
      }
    },
    "rootView": {
      "viewName": "myApp.view.App",
      "type": "XML",
      "async": true,
      "id": "app"
    },
    "dataSources": {
      "localModel": {
        "uri": "model/data.json",
        "type": "JSON"
      }
    },
    "models": {
      "": {
        "dataSource": "localModel",
        "type": "sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel",
         "settings": {
          "preload": true
        }
      }
    },
   
    "routing": {
      "config": {
        "routerClass": "sap.m.routing.Router",
        "viewType": "XML",
        "viewPath": "myApp.view",
        "controlId": "app",
        "controlAggregation": "pages",
        "async": true
      },
      "routes": [
        {
          "pattern": "",
          "name": "View1",
          "target": "View1"
        },
        {
          "pattern": "View2",
          "name": "View2",
          "target": "View2"
        }
      ],
      "targets": {
        "View1": {
          "viewName": "View1"
        },
        "View2": {
          "viewName": "View2"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}




model/data.json

{
 "employee": {
   "name": "Ashwin",
   "role": "SAPUI5 Developer"
 },
 "team": [
   { "name": "Ravi", "role": "Backend Developer" },
   { "name": "Meera", "role": "UI Designer" },
   { "name": "John", "role": "Tester" }
 ]
}


fragment/Dialog.fragment.xml

<core:FragmentDefinition xmlns="sap.m" xmlns:core="sap.ui.core">
<Dialog title="Employee Info">
<content>
<Text text="{name}" />
<Text text="{role}" />
</content>
<buttons>
<Button text="Close" press=".onCloseDialog" />
</buttons>
</Dialog>
</core:FragmentDefinition>


 View1.controller.js (fragment loading)

sap.ui.define([
 "sap/ui/core/mvc/Controller",
 "sap/m/MessageToast",
 "sap/ui/core/syncStyleClass"
], function (Controller, MessageToast, syncStyleClass) {
 "use strict";
 return Controller.extend("myApp.controller.View1", {
   onNavToView2: function () {
     this.getOwnerComponent().getRouter().navTo("View2");
   },
   onOpenDialog: function () {
     var that = this;
     if (!this._pDialog) {
       this._pDialog = this.loadFragment({ name: "myApp.fragment.Dialog" }).then(function (oDialog) {
         that.getView().addDependent(oDialog);
         // Forward content density
         var sDensity = that.getOwnerComponent().getContentDensityClass
           ? that.getOwnerComponent().getContentDensityClass()
           : "";
         if (sDensity) syncStyleClass(sDensity, that.getView(), oDialog);
         //  bind employee context to fragment
         oDialog.setModel(that.getView().getModel());
         oDialog.bindElement("/employee");
         return oDialog;
       });
     }
     this._pDialog.then(function (oDialog) { oDialog.open(); });
   },
   onCloseDialog: function () {
     if (this._pDialog) this._pDialog.then(function (oDialog) { oDialog.close(); });
   }
 });
});

 

Here is the UI Fragment:

 


Console Errors
• Component-preload.js not found
• Manifest: dataSource "localModel" not found or invalid
• Fragment opens, but data is not shown

Expected:
When I click “Open Dialog”, it should show:
Employee: Ashwin
Role: SAPUI5 Developer

Question:
• Am I binding the fragment incorrectly?
• Do I need to load the JSON model differently in BAS?
• How to fix the Component-preload.js not found error?

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

entry.title: Re: Half the World Away: A Geospatial Cautionary Tale
entry.content:
Hi Elliott,

This is Stefan from the HANA Spatial Team. I'm sorry that HANA falsely returned 0 as distance in your computations. This is a bug and should not happen.

Can you share the exact version of your HANA instance?

SELECT * FROM SYS.M_DATABASE

I tried to reproduce the result on recent revisions of HANA 2 SPS 05, SPS 07 and SPS 08 and on the latest HANA Cloud QRCs. However, in my case, a non-zero distance was returned in all cases (~19,960,468m).

As you were speculating about the algorithm: Older versions of HANA used Vincenty's Formulae. But due to the converging issues with nearly anti-podal points, we switched to Karney's algorithm in the meantime (Algorithms for geodesics).

Best regards,

Stefan

entry.title: Re: 🟡 Fun for Week 2: Petoberfest 🐱🐶🐵🐷🐻🐸🐔🐴🦬🦎🐠🦜🐧🐌🐛
How to change the device with MFA for Ariba Developer Portal
entry.content:
In order to change the device with MFA for Ariba Developer Portal, you first need to deactivate the existing MFA in the SAP Profile Management Portal.

https://accounts.sap.com/saml2/idp/sso?sp=sp.accounts.sap.com&RelayState=https://accounts.sap.com/ui/protected/profilemanagement

Once you are logged in to the portal, using relevant S-USER ID, go to authentication section, and deactivate the existing TOTP Two-Factor Authentication.

In the next step, choose any one deactivation channel and enter the required details. 

After, deactivation is successful, again activate the TOTP Two-Factor Authentication. A new QR code will pop up in the screen, you can scan it via your new device. 

After scanning is done, enter the passcode from your new device and complete the setup.

This completes the setup, your new device can be used for TOTP Two-Factor Authentication for portals like Ariba Developer Portal. Thanks!

entry.title: How to build side-by-side extensions for SAP S/4HANA public cloud with SAP BTP ABAP Trial
entry.content:
Introduction

The SAP BTP Trial has now been equipped with a central shared SAP S/4HANA public cloud instance that can be used to build side-by-side extensions. 

Since in the shared systems for the SAP BTP ABAP Environement developers are not allowed to create communication scenarios on their own this is now a great step forward since by providing pre-configure communication scenarios you are now able to walk through the development of a side-by-side scenario without having to bother with setting up the backend connectivity.  

In this article I give an overview how this setup can be leveraged in the shared trial systems for the ABAP Environment in SAP BTP Trial.

How to guides

The new setup is already been described in the following how-to-guides and missions:

SAP Discovery Center Mission - Develop extensions for SAP S/4HANA with SAP BTP, ABAP Environment, runtime

RAP620: Side-by-side extensibility with SAP BTP ABAP Environment

Technical background

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud backend

In the shared SAP S/4HANA Trial we have published read-only access to Product Master Data Including Classification using the following API 

Overview | Product Master Data Including Classification – Read | SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

This has been achieved by setting up a communication arrangement in the SAP S/4HANA public cloud instance that is based on the Communication Scenario called Product Classification Integration (SAP_COM_0309).

In addition we have enabled read and write access to Sales Order Data using the followig API 

Overview | Sales Order (A2X) | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

his has been achieved by setting up a communication arrangement in the SAP S/4HANA public cloud instance that is based on the Communication Scenario called Sales Order Integration (SAP_COM_0109) .

SAP BTP ABAP Environment - Trial

On the consumer side, in the shared SAP BTP ABAP Environment trial instances, we have created communication scenarios as well that allow for the consumption of the aforementioned scenarios.

SAP_COM_0109 (Sales Order Data)

DATA(lo_destination) = cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement(
                                                         comm_scenario  = 'ZBTP_TRIAL_SAP_COM_0109'
                                                         comm_system_id = 'ZBTP_TRIAL_SAP_COM_0109'
                                                         service_id     = 'ZBTP_TRIAL_SAP_COM_0109_REST'
                                                       ).

SAP_COM_0309 (Product Master Data)

DATA(lo_destination) = cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement(
                                                     comm_scenario  = 'ZBTP_TRIAL_SAP_COM_0309'
                                                     comm_system_id = 'ZBTP_TRIAL_SAP_COM_0309'
                                                     service_id     = 'ZBTP_TRIAL_SAP_COM_0309_REST'
                                                   ).

Test classes

In the shared trial systems you will find two test classes 

  • zcl_test_api_sales_order_srv
  • zsc_test_api_clfn_product_srv

that you can run as a console application by simply pressing F9 to show a list of products and to create a sales order in the SAP S/4HANA public shared backend system.

Especially the class zcl_test_api_sales_order_srv is of interest since it shows how to fill the description node for deep business data, so that it allows you to create the sales order header data alongside with one or more items.

entry.title: Re: Half the World Away: A Geospatial Cautionary Tale

entry.title: Re: 4AN combined with intercompany allocation
entry.content:
Hello @Anja_1 

Thank you for your follow-up SAP has not announced any roadmap item indicating it will. The Generate Intercompany Billing Request (New Solution) feature explicitly sources data from time recordings and expense postings, not from secondary allocation results.

If you want to confirm on future plans, the safest option is to use the SAP Road Map Explorer and an Influence request, but currently, there is no public note indicating the scheduled yet.

SAP Community-New Resource-Related Intercompany Billing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: BAPI for updating Payment Reference number
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We are currently working on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud – Grow Edition and have encountered a scenario where we need to update the Payment Reference Number in an accounting entry via automation. However, we have been unable to identify a suitable BAPI or Behavior Definition that allows us to perform this update.

We are aware of the I_JOURNALENTRYTP interface, which is typically used for updating accounting entries. However, we have not been able to locate a relevant field within this API that supports updating the payment reference.

 

We would appreciate your assistance in identifying:

Any available standard APIs or extensibility options to achieve this.

Relevant documentation or alternative approaches to update the Payment Reference Number in accounting entries.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: BAPI for updating Payment Reference number
entry.content:
See help.sap.com documentation on Journal Entry - Post (Asynchronous)

DebtorItem

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/b978f98fc5884ff2aeb10c8fdeb8a43b/00b2cf5794c2501de10000000a4450e5-30.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST 

herein the following is stated 

Substructure DebtorItem-PaymentDetails
Only needed if specific payment terms have been agreed upon.

...
Name              Description 
PaymentReference  Payment reference 

CreditorItem

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/b978f98fc5884ff2aeb10c8fdeb8a43b/3810d0579212c525e10000000a4450e5-31.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

Substructure CreditorItem-PaymentDetails

Name              Description 
PaymentReference  Payment reference

entry.title: Re: Designing UI5 Apps as Business Solution for SAP Build Work Zone - Part 2
entry.content:
Hi @matheusog and @theodore_abitbol ,

I did not get all details of what you did, but it looks like the pattern described in the part 4 of the old blog series using destinations: Splitting the Destination Service instance

Here you have a destination service instance per app and each of them have a destination for the reuse library.
So if this is true, it has been the best practice, but now a new way using CDM is available. 

There is no need to have a view.xml. Actually a library is intended to hold control implementations and reuse code. A view makes more sense in a reuse component, which might be embedded in a library, but this is optional.

Best regards
Matthias

entry.title: Re: BWZ CDM deployment – custom library fails to load (library.js / library-preload.js not found)
entry.content:
Hello @theodore_abitbol,

I would assume you need to create a route entry in your neo-app.json, you can find more about it in SAP Help here.

Simple example for your use:

{
  "path": "/webapp/resources/my/lib",
  "target": {
    "type": "application",
    "name": "mylib", 
    "entryPath": "/"
  },
  "description": "My library"
}

if not feasible to use the neo-app.json file, the doc here explain the conversion to xs-app.json under Application Routes

entry.title: The User response date function throws error message # Error
entry.content:
Hi Everyone 
Since the invoice date field is formatted as 05/23/2025 12:00:00 AM in the source system of the Snowflake database, I incorporated it into the prompt filter as a user response. When values are input, the user's response generates the output format specified as 05/23/2025.

To achieve results, apply the formula: format date(todate(user response("From date")); "dd/mm/yyyy hh:mm: ss AM"): "dd/mm/yyyy".
The results show # error

entry.title: Re: Bank statement - XML file with a webaddress in a tag...
entry.content:
Hi,

no I think you should escalate this to your bank. They have to show you, where this is mentioned in the specification? Which format is this CAMT053? I looked at it I cannot find any place where there is another in-tag information behind Ntry.

And also in the past 8 years, I never saw anyone with a bank sending such a corrupted file. Your bank has to follow the standard - if they don't they have to provide you a solution. I can speak for SAP and we adhere to the standard, the banks should as well because if not - what's the point of having a standard in first place?

 

You could try to play around with the Incoming File Mapping Engine at SAP: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/3cb1182b4a184bdd93f8d62e3f1f0741/ae997550be9deb55e10000000a445394.html 

You can also search for the public cloud docu. But tbh I wouln't bother wasting time for it - when the bank doesn't follow the standard, it shouldn't be the extra work you put now into place.

 

 

Best,

Edrilan Berisha

entry.title: Cant reuse variable within same automation in SAP BPA
entry.content:
Hi all, we are using automation scenario where certain variant is selected in sap gui (row 0 for example) and result of this is sent to defined users. Both variant row and email recipients are later defined in environment variables. In IRPA (predecessor of BPA) these variables were always defined when creating scenario trigger, so it was possible to define them for each new trigger. Now in BPA this seems to be not working as variables need to be defined when deploying the scenario. 

I wonder if this functionality is gone or is there any other approach how to leverage same scenario and run it with another variables? So far this seems to be like step beck as I would have to clone the same scenario and deploy it only because of another variables.

Many thanks for your answer.

entry.title: Unable to Execute “Advance Return for Tax on Sales/Purchases” in Background
entry.content:
While executing the GST report using the Fiori app “Create Advance Return for Tax on Sales/Purchases”, we noticed that the option “Execute in Background” is greyed out and cannot be selected.

In the ECC system, there was an option to process the batch input session immediately or execute the report directly in background.

However, in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, we can only execute the report interactively. When the batch input session is created, it can be viewed under the app “Batch Input Sessions in My Area”, but there is no option to process these sessions in background - only foreground execution is possible.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Unable to Execute “Advance Return for Tax on Sales/Pu...
entry.content:
This is standard system behaviour in S/4HANA Public Cloud.

The Fiori app Batch Input Sessions in My Area only allows foreground execution for security and architectural reasons, and this cannot be changed or customized.

In S/4HANA Cloud, all background processing must be handled through the “Schedule Tax Jobs” app instead.

To automate the GST report and related postings in background:

Open the app Schedule Tax Jobs.

Choose the template “Advance Return for Tax on Sales/Purchases”.

Enter the same selection parameters used in your manual run.

Schedule the job for immediate or periodic execution.

This approach ensures that the system automatically generates and posts the tax return data without requiring manual batch input processing.

entry.title: Re: Need Guidance for SAP C_ABAPD_2507 Exam Preparation
entry.content:
Hey Gabriel,

I’ve been in the same situation recently while preparing for my SAP certification, so I completely understand how challenging it can be to find the right study material. There are a lot of options out there, but not all of them are updated or reliable.

From my experience, after trying several sources and brands, Pass4future turned out to be the most helpful. Their C_ABAPD_2507 practice questions were well-structured, realistic, and closely matched the actual exam pattern. The explanations also made it easier to understand why each answer was correct, which really boosted my confidence.

Aside from practice questions, I’d suggest setting a clear study plan, review the syllabus topic by topic, take notes on areas you find tricky, and do timed practice sessions a few weeks before your exam.

Stay consistent with your preparation and revise regularly. You’ve got this, just keep practicing smart!

Best of luck

entry.title: Re: How to change fixed Indicator in Schedule Line in Sch...
entry.content:
The standard BAPI BAPI_SCHEDULE_MAINTAIN is designed for maintaining delivery schedules in Scheduling Agreements (ME38) but does not expose the “Fixed Indicator” field (EKET-FIXKZ) for update. This is a known limitation.

Since there is no standard BAPI exposes EKET-FIXKZ, implement a custom wrapper function module around standard logic and read the schedule line (EKET). Update FIXKZ using CALL FUNCTION ‘ME_UPDATE_SCHEDULE_LINE’ or direct update via BAPI with enhancement or Use BAdI ME_PROCESS_SCHED or user exit EXIT_SAPMM06E_012.

entry.title: Re: Custom Money field is not working as expected
entry.content: First, the assignment level field also needs the calculate total check box checked. Also, The calculation is only partially visible so I cannot see if there is an issue with the formula. What you need to do is deconstruct the formula (remove conditions until only one remains and test, repeating the process with one condition at a time until the formula is complete)to ensure the results are correct and make sure all the fields in the ALCF chain have a calculate total check box checked.

entry.title: Data Quality with Artificial Intelligence (AI)
entry.content:
Utilizing AI for Data Quality:

  • AI capabilities do a great job when it comes to automating data capture, identifying duplicated, corrupted, or missing data pieces, detecting and minimizing errors, and assessing data relevance.
  • AI-powered predictive analytics may help identify potential flaws in data migration scenarios and help prevent them. Some cutting-edge data management platforms already harness the power of AI technologies to ensure hassle-free and efficient data quality management. 
  • One of the biggest advantages of artificial intelligence is that the AI-backed systems and technologies of the present day can help gather and organise humungous volumes of data which are not possible to comprehend manually. This is a huge plus point for organisations that deal with such large amounts of data, as well as for those that offer data management solutions and services, like SAP and its partners

 

AI capabilities within Data Quality:

Applications of AI in data quality management, including data cleansing, matching, deduplication, and enrichment:

Data Cleansing: AI algorithms can identify consistent data patterns, thereby identify data anomalies, correct data errors, missing values. Machine learning models can learn from historical data patterns to predict and fill any missing information.

Data Matching and Deduplication: AI techniques, such as fuzzy matching and clustering algorithms, can identify and merge duplicate records, even when they are not exact matches. This helps in maintaining a single, accurate version of each data entity.

Data Enrichment: AI can enhance data by integrating additional information from external sources. For example, machine learning models can analyse customer data to predict demographic attributes or purchasing behaviour, enriching the existing dataset with valuable insights.

 

Predictive Data Quality Monitoring: AI can continuously monitor data quality in real-time, using predictive analytics to identify potential issues before they become critical. This proactive approach helps in maintaining high data quality standards throughout the migration process.

SAP offers AI Infrastructure and tools like SAP AI Core & SAP AI Launchpad for an unified AI consumption and lifecycle management of all types of AI scenarios. The management of operations of AI scenarios such as versioning, training, deployment and serving is provided through AI Launchpad.

SAP AI Core:

SAP AI Core service on SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP).  SAP AI Core is a service within the SAP Business Technology Platform. It seamlessly integrates with SAP solutions, allowing any AI function to be easily implemented using open-source frameworks. SAP AI Core supports full lifecycle management of AI scenarios. Handles large volume of data. Can be configured for open-source machine learning frameworks. Users can access generative AI capabilities through the generative AI hub.

SAP AI Core lets you make data-driven decisions confidently and efficiently. It handles large volumes of data and offers scalable machine learning capabilities to automate tasks. SAP AI Core includes preconfigured SAP solutions and supports open-source machine learning (ML) frameworks.

SAP AI Core allows you to experiment with and utilize natural language prompts with a variety of generative AI models in the generative AI hub.

 

Features

Generative AI hub

Choose from a selection of generative AI models for prompt experimentation and prompt lifecycle management.

Execute pipelines

Execute pipelines as a batch job, for example, to preprocess or train your models, or perform batch inference.

Serve inference requests

Deploy а trained machine learning model as a Web service to serve inference requests of trained models with high performance.

Manage the AI scenario lifecycle

Manage your ML artifacts and workflows, such as model training, metrics tracking, data, models, and model deployments via a uniform API lifecycle.

Benefit from multitenancy support

Use this service in tenant-aware applications. Implement multi-tenant services to segregate your AI assets and executions to isolate your tenants within SAP AI Core.

 

 

Architectural Overview

  • The main components we will use for the setup are:
  • 1. SAP AI Launchpad: Graphical interface to manage AI Core connections, executions, and logs.
  • 2. SAP HANA Database: SAP technology for materialized tables. As of now, there is no straight connection from SAP Data Sphere to AI Core, you need HANA to manage the materialization of the data.
  • 3. GCP Artifact Registry: A private container registry to store Docker images. (AI Core has native Docker Hub support, but Azure Container Registry and other services also work.)
  • 4. GitHub repository: Our code repository of choice, but some services such as BitBucket or GitLab are also supported.

 

Architecture Overview

  1. SAP Build Apps: Serves as the front-end development platform for crafting intuitive user interfaces
  2. SAP AI Core: Acts as the robust runtime engine that executes AI workloads and delivers foundation model capabilities
  3. BTP Destination: Functions as the middleware layer that securely connects Build Apps to AI Core, ensuring smooth and scalable integration.

The integration flow works as follows:

Users engage with the application through the intuitive SAP Build Apps interface. When an input is submitted, it is seamlessly transmitted via BTP Destinations to SAP AI Core, which orchestrates the request. AI Core then processes the input using the powerful GPT-4o model hosted on Azure OpenAI. Once the AI generates a response, the result is returned through the same secure channel and elegantly displayed within the Build Apps interface for the user.

 

 

Prerequisites

  1. SAP BTP account (free tier)
  2. Access to SAP AI Core with sap-internal or extended service plan
  3. SAP Build Apps subscription
  4. SAP AI Launchpad subscription

Step 1: Setting Up Your SAP BTP Environment

Enable Required Services or Applications

  1. Navigate to your SAP BTP Global Account
  2. Go to Instances and Subscriptions section
  3. Search for and enable these applications:
    • AI Launchpad
    • AI Core
    • Build Apps

Subscribe to SAP Build Apps 

 

Related Information

Generative AI Hub in SAP AI Core

AI API Overview

SAP AI Launchpad

SAP AI Core ToolKit

SAP AI Launchpad

SAP AI Launchpad is a multitenant software as a service-SaaS application on SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) that serves as a central hub for managing AI use cases and generative AI capabilities across various AI runtimes like SAP AI Core via the Generative AI hub.

Its architecture features the Launchpad itself, which connects to multiple AI runtime instances, the Generative AI Hub for managing prompts and LLMs, and the AI API that standardizes the management of AI scenarios across different back-end systems

 

The following features are available for SAP AI Launchpad:

Integrate with AI runtime instances Add connections to one or more AI runtime instances and switch between them to carry out further actions.

Work with resource groups of SAP AI Core Access your resource groups from your SAP AI Core runtime and perform actions only on the AI assets that they contain (for example, models, executions, and deployments).

Manage the lifecycle of Gen AI prompts Access the Generative AI Hub and manage the lifecycle of your prompts. The Generative AI Hub includes prompt experimentation, prompt lifecycle management, and administrative tools.

Manage the lifecycle of AI use cases Explore and manage the lifecycle of all your AI use cases. The lifecycle includes training and deploying AI models to generate endpoints for online predictions

Access statistics on your use cases View statistics about your AI use cases (scenarios) and how they are consumed. By analyzing these statistics, you can better estimate your computing needs for your AI runtimes. Manage administration for SAP AI Core

Manage administration tasks for your SAP AI Core runtime, such as the authentications required in your AI workflows.

Core Components

  • SAP AI Launchpad: The multitenant SaaS application providing the user interface for managing AI use cases and resources. 
  • AI Runtimes (e.g., SAP AI Core): The underlying services that host and execute AI models and workloads. SAP AI Launchpad connects to these runtimes to manage their assets. 
  • Generative AI Hub: A component integrated with SAP AI Core and SAP AI Launchpad for managing and experimenting with generative AI models and prompts. 
  • AI API: A standardized interface that enables consistent AI lifecycle management (scenario management) across different runtimes, regardless of the technology (e.g., SAP-based or partner-provided). 

Key Architectural Aspects

  1. Centralized Management: SAP AI Launchpad acts as a single pane of glass to oversee and manage AI use cases, models, and resources across various instances of AI runtimes.
  2. Runtime Agnosticism: It can connect to multiple AI runtime instances, such as SAP AI Core, and allows users to switch between them for different tasks, offering flexibility in deploying AI workloads.
  3. Lifecycle Management: The platform simplifies the end-to-end lifecycle of AI models, from training and evaluation to deployment and monitoring, ensuring consistency and control.
  4. Generative AI Integration: It provides access to the Generative AI Hub, which includes tools for prompt management, experimentation, and lifecycle management of large language models (LLMs).
  5. AI API for Standardization: The AI API provides a consistent interface for managing AI scenarios on diverse runtime environments, abstracting away the complexities of different underlying infrastructures.
  6. Scalability: Being a SaaS application on SAP BTP, it benefits from the platform's scalability, allowing businesses to manage growing AI initiatives

 

Overview of SAP AI Launchpad and SAP AI Core (as the AI Runtime)

 

Related Information

Using SAP AI Launchpad

Other AI Tools - Microsoft Co-Pilot Pro

 

Applications of AI under SAP Machine learning Ops where is it used -

Productization – If you refer stages, it is Data management AI Exploration – AI exploration happens under Jupiter notebook, Python and so on.  But in SAP context, tooling like Python or Business Application Studio which is our integrated development environment (IDE) in BTP hub.

Productionization, SAP Core from run time engine monitoring capabilities or AI use case.

Feature engineering there are many tools but under Product ML ops life cycle management and ML ops platform SAP AI Core and SAP AI Launchpad realistic helps to monitor these models and how you can modify

How SAP AI tools help enterprise customers –

AI launchpad is not only for customers or partners but with internal enterprise customers – stakeholders like in S/4 Ariba, SuccessFactors or in Concur, which underlying runs from SAP perspective on SAP AI core.

The other side is enterprise customers so specific user case cant use, but in SAP landscape context, need to implement in SAP landscape under SAP AI core launchpad.

 

Pre-requisites needed for AI Project, Productionization of AI use cases:

Data management layer or a constructive DM pipeline with all experiments performed under AI exploration phase along with following-

  1. Environment which gives the option to reproduce.
  2. Data management data changes tracking mechanism and ways to evaluate these.
  3. Docker and Kubernetes environment from Infrastructure perspective.
  4. Guidelines and principles perspective, incorporation of git ops principle into the processes and source code and pipelines.
  5. AP AI core which is what you need is providing the code and environment where this has to run (e.g., Python or Java depends on use case) and syncing to the GitHub repository

Scaling AI requires standardization of processes and tools-

AI Productionization – AI scalable technologies to deploy manage and integrate AI scenarios.

Unified Data management to capture real time value from different types of data and to fuel AI solutions.

AI Exploration and Modelling

 

When to use these AI core or AI launchpad?

Good to understand, what we have in the portfolio and the scope.  We have SAP AI Business surfaces, due to which, Test Use cases are easy to use in order to set the Ariba, SuccessFactors, S/4 Concur which have embedded AI scenarios and AI Business services.

But, in case of enterprise to the industry, then we need to be able to establish SAP connectivity in SAP context and then run on SAP AI Core and SAP AI Launchpad.

  • AI Core is the engine (where the work is done), and AI Launchpad is the dashboard (where the work is managed and monitored).
  • AI Core is where the actual logic and profile tasks run, can be considered processor.  AI Launchpad is the dashboard, where tasks running under AI Core is managed and monitored.

For SAP Data Quality Profiling, here’s when to use each –

  1. Use SAP AI Core for the actual execution, data format checks and run the actual data profiling logic and data analysis at scale.
  2. AI core is where you define and execute the custom code (e.g., Python or R Scripts to perform analytical tasks like –
    1. Calculating descriptive statistics for data fields (min, max, mean).
    2. Measuring data completeness (percentage of non-null values).
    3. Determining data uniqueness (identifying duplicates).
    4. Analysing data consistency and format validity.
    5. Identifying outliers and anomalies in your SAP data.
  • AI Launchpad is where the profiling reports are managed and review the results of the data anomalies.

Triggering the execution of data profiling workflow in AI Core

Monitor the job progress, check logs and ensure profiling task runs successfully.

Reviewing Outputs: Once the AI Core job is complete, the Launchpad is your centralized place to view the resulting data quality reports and metrics (which are the artifacts generated by the AI Core execution). This allows a business analyst or data steward to review the profile without needing to interact with the underlying technical infrastructure.

As the predecessor to Data Quality checks, the Data should be profiled to identifying missing values, duplicates, and inconsistencies, ensuring that only high-quality data is processed

  • Data Quality Dimensions used to access Data Quality: 

 

 Dimensions

Description

Example.

Accuracy

Extent to which data objects correctly represent the real-world values for which they are designed

A material must have a price

Completeness

Extent to which data is not missing

An order is not complete without a payment method

Conformity

Extent to which data conforms to a specified format

Created date must be in the format YYYY/MM/DD

Consistency

Extent to which distinct data instances provide non-conflicting information about the same underlying object

The salary range for level 3 employees must be between $40,000 and $50,000

Integrity

Extent to which data is not missing important relationship linkages

The date for placing an order must be valid

Timeliness

Extent to which data is sufficiently up to date for the task at hand

Christmas lights are in stock by December

Uniqueness

Extent to which the data has unique with no duplicates

Customer#, Vendor# etc. need to be unique

 

  • High-volume data processing: It's designed to handle large amounts of data from SAP applications to create robust AI models. 
  • Integration with SAP applications: It helps to seamlessly embed and operationalize AI capabilities directly into other SAP solutions. 
  • Monitoring and Governance: You want to monitor job status, logs, inference metrics, and track deployments for governance and compliance. 
  • Accessing Generative AI: It includes a generative AI hub for prompt engineering, lifecycle management, and interacting with pre-built generative AI models.

 

  • Integration:
  • Since data profiling is an intensive data preparation step, we use AI Core to orchestrate the pipeline that connects to your SAP data sources (like SAP HANA Cloud or SAP Datasphere) by leveraging SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) as a unified platform to pull the data and run the profiling jobs.
  • Data Privacy / Security Considerations:
  • We can use BTP to call a 3rd party hosted model on Azure, AWS, or OpenAI.
  • AWS Bedrock is an A.I. service offered by Amazon and they clearly state that it is secure and private and Customers can use Bedrock, in compliance with SAP GDPR.

 

End-to-End Architecture, High Level Flow:

Below framework depicts the high level architecture and flow incorporating data privacy / security covering the code interface

entry.title: Re: PCR for PF Calculation Using Processed Basic
entry.content:
You have made a minor change to the Operations of PCR Z023 for ESG * and WT 1000, but I was suggesting that the change should be made in ESG 3 and WT 1000.

 

First, you should not need to query Processing Class 20 for WT 1000 since it has only one return value (3) That VWTCL 20 Operation may be required for WT ****, but should not be for WT 1000.   Only Operations ADDWT&ZBVE, ADDWTE* and ADDCU are required.

Next, make sure that Function PRINT is placed in your Payroll schema after PCR Z023 but before PCR ZREC so that you could confirm that your Temporary Variable is created correctly. 

Last, do a Payroll Simulation for one PERNR, with the "Display Log" box checked, and drill down into that Log to see how WT 1000 is processed in PCRs Z023, Z011 and ZREC (and post the screen capture of that processing).

Still if you want to have a look at some demo data modelling regarding Emebedded Analytics in ABAP CDS, you can refer you to the following learning: https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/developing-analytical-queries-using-abap-core-data-services

entry.title: Customer can see software in 1CSW but not in SAP4M via partner
entry.content:
Hello,
we are facing a situation where a customer managed via a partner can access on premise licences download on  1CSW  but they cant on Sap For Me. My understanding is that only partner have authorisation to access the tool, yet, i wonder if there any legit, workaround to allow the download in Sap For Me. Thanks. Mauro

entry.title: Re: User ID for IAS users
entry.content:
Hello @dyaryura  Hello @MatthiasL 

Thanks again for the helpful discussions!

I still need some clarification on the technical setup of Global User ID  for example SAC especially how it works with IPS and SSO

We provision users from Entra ID → IAS → SAC. The Global User ID is automatically created and assigned to each user in IAS.

I'm not exactly sure how to implement this Global User ID in a Cloud Application. I have two main ideas (options) and need help deciding which is the correct and recommended way.

Option 1: UUID in a Custom SAC Attribute, SSO via Custom SAML Mapping

  • User Provisioning ( Target System - SAC)

              The Global User ID ($['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:User']['userUuid']) is provisioned into a custom attribute in SAC. For example:

  

{

 "sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:User']['userUuid']",

  "optional": true,

  "targetPath": "$.attributes.customGlobalUserID"

}

The custom attribute „customGlobalUserID“ will be created in SAC.

  • SAC SSO Setup:
    • In SAC for "User Attribute to map to your identity provider," I select "Custom SAML User Mapping  and choose  the attribute „customGlobalUserID“
    • The "USER ID" field in SAC would be filled with the "Login Name"  Value from IAS (e.g., testname).

 

Option 2: GUID Directly into SAC's "USER ID" Field, SSO via USER ID Mapping

  • User Provisioning (Target System - SAC):

                       The Global User ID ($['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:User']['userUuid']) is provisioned directly into "USER ID" field in SAC. For example:

  {

  "sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:User']['userUuid']",

  "targetPath": "$['urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters']['userName']"

}

 

  • SAC SSO Setup:
    • For "User Attribute to map to your identity provider," I will select "USER ID."

 

I haven't fully understood the implementation yet and would really appreciate your help.

Thank you in advance!!!

Best regards

entry.title: 🚀 SAP BTP Weekly | Innovación segura, automatización inteligente y futuro sostenible
entry.content:
🛡️ 1️⃣ Seguridad mejorada en BTP: rotación automática de claves y CAPTCHA ampliado

🔹 SAP anunció en su Q3 2025 mejoras clave en Security & Identity Management. 🔹 Incluye rotación automática de claves de acceso, nuevos logs de aprovisionamiento en tiempo real y protección CAPTCHA incluso para verificación telefónica. 🔹 También llegan comandos de consola para certificados personalizados.

💬 Análisis: SAP sigue fortaleciendo la capa operativa de seguridad. La rotación automática reduce riesgos humanos, pero exige revisar integraciones para que las apps soporten las nuevas claves. Además, las APIs y logs abren la puerta a integraciones con SIEM corporativos.

📎 Q3 2025 Quarterly Release Highlights: SAP BTP Security & IAM ❓ ¿Tus pipelines ya contemplan rotación automática de credenciales o siguen siendo manuales?

🧱 2️⃣ Riesgos en arquitecturas híbridas: seguridad entre BTP y el core

El crecimiento de BTP en entornos híbridos trajo nuevos retos: ⚙️ conexiones mal configuradas, 👤 cuentas técnicas con privilegios excesivos, 🚨 y falta de monitoreo entre sistemas on-premise y cloud.

Onapsis recomienda aplicar el principio de menor privilegio, segmentar destinos y usar alertas de comportamiento anómalo.

💬 Análisis: La promesa del híbrido es flexibilidad, pero también implica más puntos vulnerables. Cada destino en BTP es una posible puerta lateral si no se gestiona bien. La buena noticia: SAP ya integra alertas y trazabilidad más robustas; la mala, que muchas organizaciones aún no tienen visibilidad unificada de sus conexiones. Un gobierno efectivo requiere mapear todos los destinos, controlar privilegios y automatizar validaciones.Para el CIO, esto no es un problema técnico: es un riesgo reputacional si una brecha surge desde el entorno cloud.

📎 Securing the Bridge – Onapsis

🎓 3️⃣ SAP TechEd 2025: confianza, IA y estrategia BTP

📍 Berlín y online | 4–6 noviembre Este año, SAP TechEd pone el foco en IA responsable, seguridad y automatización empresarial. La pista “Building Trust on BTP” mostrará cómo aplicar IA generativa con cumplimiento normativo, y habrá nuevas certificaciones en SAP Build y AI Developer.

💬 Análisis: TechEd siempre marca tendencias. Este año, SAP busca demostrar que IA y seguridad no son opuestos, sino complementarios. La idea de “trust by design” será central: usar IA generativa bajo marcos de control auditables. Para los arquitectos, esto significa que el BTP no solo será más inteligente, sino también más predecible. Y para los líderes de negocio, TechEd será el momento de evaluar cómo conectar Joule y Build con la realidad operativa.

📎 Agenda oficial SAP TechEd 2025

🤖 4️⃣ Joule Studio y automatización inteligente

SAP Joule Studio permite crear agentes de IA sin código directamente sobre Build Process Automation. Un CFO o analista puede describir en lenguaje natural un proceso, y Joule lo convierte en flujo automatizado. El reto: asegurar trazabilidad y control en automatizaciones generadas por usuarios.

💬 Análisis: Este paso cambia el juego: los procesos dejan de ser diseñados solo por TI. Con Joule Studio, áreas como Finanzas o RRHH pueden construir automatizaciones útiles en minutos. Sin embargo, el reto está en la gobernanza: definir quién puede crear, auditar y modificar esos flujos. El CIO gana velocidad, pero debe mantener control. El equilibrio entre autonomía y seguridad definirá el éxito.

📎 SAP Joule Studio

♻️ 5️⃣ FinOps y sostenibilidad: control financiero y ambiental en una sola vista

SAP refuerza su visión ESG con Sustainability Control Tower y Green Ledger, integradas con BTP y S/4HANA Cloud. CFOs y COOs pueden medir impacto ambiental junto al financiero, automatizando reportes ESG. Combinado con FinOps, permite reducir gastos cloud y alinear sostenibilidad y rentabilidad.

💬 Análisis: El control financiero y la sostenibilidad se vuelven inseparables. BTP permite que el impacto ambiental se mida con el mismo rigor que el financiero. Para el CFO, significa tener visibilidad completa de costos y emisiones. Para TI, implica integrar métricas ESG dentro de los procesos operativos. Este enfoque convierte la sostenibilidad en una ventaja competitiva, no en un “compliance más”.

📎 SAP Sustainability Control Tower

🧩 6️⃣ Extensibilidad guiada: el “wizard” que simplifica SAP Build y CAP

El nuevo Extensibility Wizard ayuda a construir extensiones seguras para S/4HANA desde BTP, asegurando compatibilidad con upgrades y manteniendo el clean core. Menos “custom code spaghetti”, más agilidad y trazabilidad.

💬 Análisis: SAP da un paso firme hacia la estandarización de extensiones. El wizard facilita que incluso equipos sin experiencia profunda en ABAP construyan ampliaciones seguras y mantenibles. Esto acelera proyectos sin comprometer el core. El desafío: convencer a los equipos de desarrollo tradicionales de abandonar el “custom code” artesanal y adoptar un enfoque guiado, pero más sostenible.

📎 Extensibility Wizard – Blog SAP

🔗 7️⃣ Joule + Microsoft Copilot: colaboración aumentada entre ecosistemas

La alianza SAP–Microsoft da un paso más: Joule se integra con Microsoft 365 Copilot, permitiendo consultar y accionar datos SAP directamente desde Teams, Outlook o Excel. Ejemplo: “¿Cuál fue el gasto real del Q3?” — y Joule responde en segundos con datos de SAP Analytics Cloud. Una nueva forma de productividad aumentada, donde BTP se convierte en el puente entre AI empresarial y colaboración diaria.

💬 Análisis: La frontera entre ERP y oficina se difumina. Con Joule + Copilot, un usuario puede consultar información crítica de SAP sin salir de Teams. Esto convierte la colaboración diaria en un entorno de decisión asistida por IA. Para los CIOs, implica una nueva prioridad: gobernar el acceso a datos sensibles que ahora fluyen por herramientas colaborativas. Una integración poderosa, pero que exige políticas sólidas de seguridad y contexto de uso.

📎 SAP + Microsoft AI Partnership

¿Qué equilibrio te resulta más desafiante hoy? 👉 Seguridad 👉 Velocidad 👉 Gobernanza

Déjamelo en los comentarios — la transformación BTP la construimos entre todos 💬
